thread.title: Section II football roundup
thread.title_full: Section II football roundup - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: Section II football roundup
text:
Photo: Cindy Schultz Image 1 of / 1 Caption
Close
Image 1 of 1 Burnt Hills' Michael Leveroni, left, veers away from Queensbury's Jared Bruno's oncoming tackle during their football game on Saturday, Sept. 26, 2015, at Queensbury High in Queensbury, N.Y. (Cindy Schultz / Times Union)
Buy this photo Photo: Cindy Schultz Burnt Hills' Michael Leveroni, left, veers away from Queensbury's... Section II football roundup 1 / 1 Back to Gallery CLASS A
Queensbury 34, Scotia 14
Player of the game: Queensbury's Patrick Conway had five carries and scored four touchdowns.
Play of the game: Conway's second score gave Queensbury the lead for good.
Stat of the game: Scotia quarterback Ricky Woodley had 146 yards and a touchdown on the ground.
Notable: Scotia dropped to 0-6 overall and 0-4 in league play. ... Queensbury moves to 4-2 and 3-1. ... Freshman Brendan Scott had 87 yards and a touchdown on just seven carries for Queensbury.
Burnt Hills 50, Gloversville 14
Player of the game: Burnt Hills running back Mike Leveroni accounted for 191 yards and two touchdowns, one on the ground and one through the air, in the first half; he added another 39 yards and another touchdown in the third quarter.
Stat of the game: Gloversville gained 268 yards through the air and 17 on the ground.
Play of the game: In the second quarter, Leveroni took a handoff from quarterback John Clayton and raced wide, only to stop and pitch the ball back to Clayton; Clayton then found Leveroni coming out of the backfield for a 64-yard touchdown pass.
Turning point: With Burnt Hills holding an 8-7 lead early in the second quarter, Leveroni went around the corner and, after appearing to be hemmed in by Gloversville defenders, found a way out and raced 78 yards for a touchdown.
Notable: Burnt Hills, ranked second in the state Class A poll and 4-0 in the Class A Northwest Division (6-0 overall), has clinched the divisional title and will host the Southeast Division fourth-place team, the loser of next week's Mohonasen-Averill Park game, in Week 8. ... Gloversville quarterback Taylor McCreadie completed 21 of 40 passes for 268 yards and two touchdowns. ... Until the starters went to the bench in the third period, the Burnt Hills offense was almost perfect, gaining 435 yards in just 33. ... Gloversville, now 1-3 in the division and 3-3 overall, must defeat South Glens Falls next week to keep its playoff hopes alive.
CLASS B
Albany Academy 35, Cohoes 27
Play of the game: From his own 37-yard line, Cohoes' Marquis Alston turned a double reverse handoff into a 63-yard touchdown run.
Turning point of game: After Cohoes intercepted an Academy pass, Brett Young of Academy intercepted a Cohoes pass on the next play and returned it 18 yards for a touchdown.
Player of the game: Andrew Martin of Academy ran for 205 yards and two touchdowns; he also caught three passes for 77 yards and another touchdown.
Notable: Alston carried the ball six times for 157 yards and a touchdown.
CLASS C
Fonda 43, Schoburg/BKW 19
Player of the game: Fonda quarterback Dan Parslow ran for 211 yards and two touchdowns — including 139 yards on three carries in the fourth quarter. Parslow also finished 9-of-17 passing for 54 yards, with a touchdown to Kasey Neff.
Play of the game: Parslow's 51-yard touchdown run on the first play of the fourth quarter gave the Braves a two-possession lead.
Turning point: The Braves scored three touchdowns in a span of four offensive plays early in the fourth quarter to pull away.
Notable: Braves third-string running back Mitch Braun , starting due to injuries, ran for 101 yards and three touchdowns. ... Mike Flower caught six passes for 112 yards — including a 72-yard touchdown on a receiver option pass from Gary DeCarlo — to lead Schoburg.
Tamarac 14, Voorheesville 13
Player of the game: Joe Ballato had more than 100 yards of total offense to lead Tamarac. He got the Bengals rolling in the first quarter when he caught a 60-yard pass to set up his own 3-yard touchdown run on the next play that gave Tamarac a 7-0 lead.
Play of the game: With 1:20 left in the game and Voorheesvile driving for a possible go-ahead score, the Bengals defensive line stuffed Ryan Daly on a quarterback sneak on 4th and 1.
Stat of the game: The two teams combined for five interceptions.
Notable: Blackbirds running back Dalton Esposito rushed 10 times for 82 yards and two second-half touchdowns to rally Voorheesville from a 14-0 deficit. ... Brendan McCann missed an extra point following Voorheesville's second touchdown midway through the fourth quarter. A successful PAT would have tied the game. ... Tamarac improves to 2-3, Voorheesville drops to 1-5.
NONLEAGUE
Hudson Falls 34, Granville 14
Player of the game: Hudson Falls receiver Taylor Lane had seven catches for 241 yards and three touchdowns.
Play of the game: After Granville tied the score at 14 midway through the third quarter, Dalton Hogan hit Lane over the middle with a 64-yard touchdown that put the Panthers up for good.
Stat of the game: Hudson Falls quarterback Dalton Hogan completed 8 of 11 passes for 295 yards and three touchdowns.
Notable: The Hudson Falls defense held the Granville ground game to 47 yards on 24 attempts.
